intro: Lachenalia latimerae, commonly known as the Orange River lachenalia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, cylindrical stems and clusters of bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in summer, producing vibrant orange or yellow flowers that attract pollinators. It is well adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick leaves and stems. Lachenalia latimerae is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and resilience.
